CONCLUSION: Violation of Art. 6-1;Remainder inadmissible;Pecuniary damage - claim dismissed;Non-pecuniary damage - financial award;Costs and expenses partial award - domestic proceedings;Costs and expenses partial award - Convention proceedings
TEXT: CARDINAL . The applicant was born in DATE and lives in GPE , GPE .

CARDINAL . NORP In proceedings instituted by the applicant , on CARDINAL DATE ORG finally declared that his former employer had terminated his employment unlawfully and granted him severance pay and damages . Simultaneously , on DATE the applicant brought an action before ORG against the employer claiming pecuniary and non - pecuniary damages .
CARDINAL . On DATE ORG dismissed the applicant ’s claims . On appeal , on DATE PERSON Regional Court granted the applicant damages plus accrued interest .
CARDINAL . On DATE ORG review bench quashed the second - instance decision in its part concerning the pecuniary damages , and remitted this aspect of the case to ORG .

CARDINAL . In the resumed second - instance proceedings , on DATE ORG granted damages plus accrued interest to the applicant . This decision was partially quashed by ORG review bench on DATE for procedural shortcomings .

CARDINAL . In the resumed second - instance proceedings , on CARDINAL DATE ORG granted some damages plus accrued interest to the applicant and dismissed the remainder of his action . On DATE ORG review bench partially quashed this decision as ORG had miscalculated the amount granted to the applicant .
CARDINAL . In the proceedings resumed for the third time , on DATE ORG granted the applicant damages plus accrued interest .
